resources.string: Aahh! You feel the ground start to shake! What do you do?
What should you do now?
The shaking has stopped. Are you in the clear?
Take cover under a tree
Go to an open space
Hide inside a building
Continue walking around
Shout for help
Get low
Yes, the earthquake is over
No, if you move you will fall down
Mostly, but still be on the lookout for aftershocks
You always want to go away from things that can fall on you first
Good plan! Being in an area away from all objects ensures that nothing can fall on you and harm you
When you are outside you want to stay outside. If you go into a building, it could end up collapsing and hurting you!
You should always try to stay still during an earthquake
During an earthquake, if you are not hurt shouting for help will not do anything. You should first try to keep yourself safe
Nice! You should always get low so that the earthquake can not knock you over
You are correct, but you should still be on the lookout for possible aftershocks
Although there can be aftershocks, you are not in immediate danger so you are free to move
Great choice! There is always the possibility of an aftershock and you should be prepared for it
